document.topic_text: SOLUTION: What is the sum of all those natural numbers which when added to 29 gives a two digit square number? Algebra -> Sequences-and-series -> SOLUTION: What is the sum of all those natural numbers which when added to 29 gives a two digit square number? Question 1043856 : What is the sum of all those natural numbers which when added to 29 gives a two digit square number? Found 2 solutions by josgarithmetic, ikleyn : 1+2+3+4+...+70, an even number of consecutive natural numbers. That summation is You can put this solution on YOUR website! . You can easily do it yourself by working with all such two digit square numbers (36, 49, 64, 81). It would be even better than if I will do it instead of you. This problem is not for tutors. It is for you.
